result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth R. Bauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kenneth R. Bauer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kenneth R. Bauer was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any counseling or educational programs directed by agent, including attendance/completion of 24-26 week domestic abuse program.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth R. Bauer

defendant.name: Bauer, Kenneth R.
defendant.address: 14626 Murphy Ridge Road, Richland Center, WI 53581

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kenneth R. Bauer in court with attorney Thomas J. Kelly. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  ADA Forehand states that the parties have an agreement for resolution, calling for deletion of the d.a. modifier for def's plea to count 2/dc without the modifier; recom. sentence is 1 year probation.  Court allows the amendment of count 2.  To count 2, as amended, def pleads guilty.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence withheld for 1 year probation with conditions to include attendance at 24-26 wk d.a. program; attend, pay for, and succ. complete any counseling recommended by agent; pay costs.  1 day credit in the event of revocation.  Count 1 dismissed.

Defendant Kenneth R. Bauer in court with attorney Thomas J. Kelly. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. K states offer has been extended but waiting for email confirmation from the prosecutor; believes offer will be accepted; asks for jury trial to be taken off the calendar and plea/sentencing set for December.  ADA Forehand states offer is confirmed.  Counsel requests plea/sentencing in early Dec.  Court sets 12/2 at  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Status conference at 10-14-2015 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial at 11-06-2015 02:00 pm.
Jury trial at 11-11-2015 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth R. Bauer in court with attorney Thomas J. Kelly. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. K states parties have talked but not in agreement.  ADA Forehand asks for trial scheduling.  2 days estimated.  Jury instructions due Nov. 4.  Jury trial scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Kenneth R. Bauer in court with attorney Thomas J. Kelly. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading waived.  Rights stated.  NG entered.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.
to Amend Bail Conditions - "No-Contact prohibition of Defendant with RB should be deleted from (the) bail bond."

Defendant Kenneth R. Bauer in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Bail bond review hearing set at request of the victim who has asked for deletion of the no contact condition of bond.  Comment by ADA.  Comment by Court.  Def states he does not have an attorney retained but is planning to speak with one (T Kelly).  Victim addresses Court.  Court denies the request to modify bond.

Defendant Kenneth R. Bauer in court. Prosecuting Atty  Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. KB waives formal reading of the complaint. Court informs KB of maximum penalty. Does not qualify for Public Defender. Court adjourns this matter to give KB time to get an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 10:00 am. Court denies victims request for "no contact" to be dropped. Bail Bond review hearing set for April 2nd, 2015 1:30pm.
